DataElement.preferredName: Chemotherapy Prior Folfirinox Regimen Receive Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Yes or No response to earlier use of the chemicals consisting of fluorouracil, irinotecan hydrochloride, leucovorin calcium and oxaliplatin for the treatment of pancreatic cancer.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier use of the chemicals consisting of fluorouracil, irinotecan hydrochloride, leucovorin calcium and oxaliplatin for the treatment of pancreatic cancer.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.  Although this term may be used to describe any therapy involving the use of chemical-based agents, it is most commonly used to refer to the variety of chemical-based agents employed to treat cancer.  Cancer chemotherapy works by arresting or killing the growth and spread of cancer cells.  Because cancer cells usually divide much faster than normal cells, they are often very sensitive to the inhibitory actions of chemotherapeutic agents.  Chemotherapy may also include agents that enhance immune function or alter hormonal activity. (NCI04)

Concepts.definition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.

Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:A regimen consisting of fluorouracil, irinotecan hydrochloride, leucovorin calcium and oxaliplatin used for the treatment of pancreatic cancer.:To take, accept, or got something offered.

Concepts.definition: A regimen consisting of fluorouracil, irinotecan, leucovorin and oxaliplatin that can be used for the treatment of pancreatic and colorectal cancers; occult primary, ampullary, appendiceal and small bowel adenocarcinomas; well-differentiated grade 3 neuroendocrine tumors (NETs), and extrapulmonary poorly differentiated neuroendocrine carcinoma, large or small cell carcinoma and mixed neuroendocrine-non-neuroendocrine neoplasm.
To take, accept, or get something offered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
